Cobb, Kitty Winn, Jack MacGowran, and Jason Miller. The film is part of The Exorcist franchise.
The film tells the story of Regan MacNeil, a 12-year-old girl who becomes possessed by a demon and the two priests who attempt to exorcise the demon. It was the first horror film to be nominated for Best Picture at the Academy Awards, and the first (and, as of 2020, only) horror film to be nominated for the Best Picture award. It is also the highest-grossing horror film of all time, adjusted for inflation.
The Exorcist was released theatrically in the United States on December 26, 1973. It was released in the United Kingdom on May 2, 1974. The film was nominated for ten Academy Awards, including Best Picture, and won two: Best Sound and Best Adapted Screenplay. It was also nominated for three Golden Globe Awards, winning one for Best Motion Picture – Drama.
The Exorcist is widely regarded as one of the greatest horror films of all time. It was ranked #1 on Bravo’s 100 Scariest Movie Moments, #3 on the American Film Institute’s 100 Years…100 Thrills, and #10 on the AFI’s 100 Years…100 Movies (10th Anniversary Edition). In 2006, the film was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being “culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant”.
The Exorcist has been banned in several countries, including Iceland, Ireland, and Singapore. In the United States, the film was initially banned in several cities, including Chicago, Los Angeles, and New York City.
